conclusion: The problem involves finding the charge Q carried by the capacitor in a circuit with given EMF, internal resistance, resistors, and capacitance.
The circuit consists of a battery with EMF E = 6V and internal resistance r = 2Ω, fixed resistors R1 = 2Ω, R2 = 3Ω, R3 = 6Ω, and a capacitor with capacitance C = 10μF.
The current I in the circuit can be found using Ohm's Law, I = E/R.
The resistance of the battery is calculated as RB = E/r = 6V/2Ω = 3Ω.
The resistance of the two resistors in series is Rseries = R1 + R2 = 2Ω + 3Ω = 5Ω.
The total resistance of the circuit is Rtotal = RB + Rseries = 3Ω + 5Ω = 8Ω.
The current I in the circuit is calculated as I = E/Rtotal = 6V/8Ω = 0.75A.
The charge Q on the capacitor can be found using the formula Q = CV.
The voltage across the capacitor is V = I × Rtotal = 0.75A × 8Ω = 6V.
The charge Q on the capacitor is calculated as Q = CV = 6V × 10μF = 60μC.
The charge Q carried by the capacitor is 60μC.
